```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "hide"}
R <- sample(1:100, 3) # resistance (ohms)

ans <- 1 / sum(1/R)

sc <- num_to_schoice(ans, range = c(0.5, 2)*ans, delta = ans/10, format = FALSE, digits = 5)
sc$questions <- sprintf("$%g \\,\\mathsf{\\Omega}$", signif(sc$questions, 2))
```
Question
========
Three resistors are connected in **parallel**. Their resistances are $`r R[1]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$, $`r R[2]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$, and $`r R[3]` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$. What is the equivalent resistance of the resistors?

```{r, echo = FALSE, results = "asis"}
answerlist(sc$questions, markup = "markdown")
```

Solution
========
The equivalent resistance of resistors in parallel is 

$$R = \left( \frac{1}{R_1} + \frac{1}{R_2} + \frac{1}{R_3}\right)^{-1} = `r signif(ans, 2)` \,\mathsf{\Omega}$$
